snippet: President Obama’s victory is likely to resonate in some unusual ways across the Atlantic, where the role of government in a time of economic stress is equally divisive.
abstract: Victory of Pres Obama in election that focused on role of government in economy is likely to resonate in some unusual ways in Europe, where leaders remain locked in contentious struggle over austerity, slow growth and future of European welfare state; those leaders who have advocated for more active government role will likely benefit, whereas supporters of austerity measures may have more to lose.

byline.contributor: Maïa de la Baume and Scott Sayare contributed reporting from Paris, and Gaia Pianigiani from Rome.

lead_paragraph: President Obama’s victory is likely to resonate in some unusual ways across the Atlantic, where the role of government in a time of economic stress is equally divisive.

headline.seo: Obama Victory Brings Europe a Sense of Continuity and Relief
headline.main: Obama Victory Brings Europe a Sense of Continuity and Relief
headline.print_headline: For Leaders Struggling With Europe’s Economic Stress, Election an Ocean Away Hits Home
